title: Panther

A **panther**, f, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a large, quadrupedal [feline](/wiki/Feline "Feline") that is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") and can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision") like all felines.

A panther has two claw attacks and a bite attack.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Panthers have [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Origin](#Origin)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.3 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [5.4 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated panthers are always created hostile.

## Strategy

Panthers are slightly stronger than [lynxes](/wiki/Lynx "Lynx") and also possess 15 [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed"), making them hazardous for a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") in the early game that has a lower level and/or poor [AC](/wiki/AC "AC").

## History

The panther first appears in [NetHack-- 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack--_3.1.3 "NetHack-- 3.1.3"), and makes its vanilla *NetHack* debut in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Panthera](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panthera "wikipedia:Panthera")***

The panther, or *Panthera*, is a genus of big cats within the family Felidae, and one of two in the subfamily *Pantherinae*. It contains the largest living members of the cat family, with five living species: the jaguar, leopard, lion, snow leopard, and tiger. Most members of *Panthera* are native to equatorial regions. "Panther" can refer to any of these "big cats", with the usage being somewhat regional: in some parts of North America, "panther" refers to the cougar (*Puma concolor*), while in South America it is used to mean the jaguar (*Panthera onca*), and elsewhere it is used to mean the leopard (*Panthera pardus*).

Depictions of a specific "panther" in media such as *NetHack* usually correspond to the [black panther](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_panther "wikipedia:Black panther"), a melanistic colour variant of the leopard and jaguar. Black panthers of both species have excess black pigments, and have been documented mostly in tropical forests—black leopards are found in Africa and Asia, and black jaguars are seen in South America.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), panthers can generate in [real zoos](/wiki/Real_zoo "Real zoo").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) [Werepanthers](/wiki/Werepanther "Werepanther") summoning help have a 1⁄5 chance of generating a hostile panther on each applicable square[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) - a hero that gets lycanthropy from a werepanther can summon panthers as pets with the same probability by using the [#monster](/wiki/Monster_\(command\) "Monster (command)") [extended command](/wiki/Extended_command "Extended command"), which costs 10 [power](/wiki/Power "Power").

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), panthers appear among the random f that are part of the second [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster class for [Cavepeople](/wiki/Cavepeople "Cavepeople") and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Caveman quest](/wiki/Caveman_quest "Caveman quest").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, [Gladiators](/wiki/Gladiator "Gladiator") can obtain gold by killing panthers.

Panthers appear among the random f that are part of the first quest [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") for [Zookeepers](/wiki/Zookeeper "Zookeeper") and make up 24⁄175 (14%) of the monsters randomly generated on the [Zookeeper quest](/index.php?title=Zookeeper_quest\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Zookeeper quest (page does not exist)").

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, panthers can [jump](/wiki/Jump "Jump") after their targets.

## Encyclopedia entry

And lo! almost where the ascent began,  
A panther light and swift exceedingly,  
Which with a spotted skin was covered o'er!  
   
And never moved she from before my face,  
Nay, rather did impede so much my way,  
That many times I to return had turned.

\[ Dante's Inferno, as translated  
                by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [mkroom.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 803](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/mkroom.c#line803 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/mkroom.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [were.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 139](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/were.c#line139 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/were.c")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

f panther
Difficulty 7
Attacks

Claw 1d6, claw 1d6, bite 1d10

Base level 5
Base experience 59
Speed 15
Base AC 6
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 600
Nutritional value 300
Size Large
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A panther:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line369

A panther, f, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is a large, quadrupedal feline that is carnivorous and can be seen via infravision like all felines.

A panther has two claw attacks and a bite attack.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Panthers have infravision.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Origin

    • 5.1 SLASH'EM

Generation

Randomly generated panthers are always created hostile.

Strategy

Panthers are slightly stronger than lynxes and also possess 15 speed, making them hazardous for a hero in the early game that has a lower level and/or poor AC.

History

The panther first appears in NetHack-- 3.1.3, and makes its vanilla NetHack debut in NetHack 3.3.0.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Panthera

The panther, or Panthera, is a genus of big cats within the family Felidae, and one of two in the subfamily Pantherinae. It contains the largest living members of the cat family, with five living species: the jaguar, leopard, lion, snow leopard, and tiger. Most members of Panthera are native to equatorial regions. "Panther" can refer to any of these "big cats", with the usage being somewhat regional: in some parts of North America, "panther" refers to the cougar (Puma concolor), while in South America it is used to mean the jaguar (Panthera onca), and elsewhere it is used to mean the leopard (Panthera pardus).

Depictions of a specific "panther" in media such as NetHack usually correspond to the black panther, a melanistic colour variant of the leopard and jaguar. Black panthers of both species have excess black pigments, and have been documented mostly in tropical forests—black leopards are found in Africa and Asia, and black jaguars are seen in South America.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, panthers can generate in real zoos.[1] Werepanthers summoning help have a 1⁄5 chance of generating a hostile panther on each applicable square[2] - a hero that gets lycanthropy from a werepanther can summon panthers as pets with the same probability by using the #monster extended command, which costs 10 power.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, panthers appear among the random f that are part of the second quest monster class for Cavepeople and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Caveman quest.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, in addition to SLASH'EM details, Gladiators can obtain gold by killing panthers.

Panthers appear among the random f that are part of the first quest monster class for Zookeepers and make up 24⁄175 (14%) of the monsters randomly generated on the Zookeeper quest.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, in addition to SLASH'EM details, panthers can jump after their targets.

Encyclopedia entry

And lo! almost where the ascent began,
A panther light and swift exceedingly,
Which with a spotted skin was covered o'er!
 
And never moved she from before my face,
Nay, rather did impede so much my way,
That many times I to return had turned.

[ Dante's Inferno, as translated
                by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow ]

References

  1. ↑ mkroom.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 803
  2. ↑ were.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 139

A '''panther''', {{monsym|panther}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a large, quadrupedal [[feline]] that is [[carnivorous]] and can be seen via [[infravision]] like all felines.

A panther has two claw attacks and a bite attack.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|Panthers have [[infravision]].}}

==Generation==
Randomly generated panthers are always created hostile.

==Strategy==
Panthers are slightly stronger than [[lynx]]es and also possess 15 [[speed]], making them hazardous for a [[hero]] in the early game that has a lower level and/or poor [[AC]].

==History==
The panther first appears in [[NetHack-- 3.1.3]], and makes its vanilla ''NetHack'' debut in [[NetHack 3.3.0]].

==Origin==
{{Wikipedia|Panthera}}
The panther, or ''Panthera'', is a genus of big cats within the family Felidae, and one of two in the subfamily ''Pantherinae''. It contains the largest living members of the cat family, with five living species: the jaguar, leopard, lion, snow leopard, and tiger. Most members of ''Panthera'' are native to equatorial regions. "Panther" can refer to any of these "big cats", with the usage being somewhat regional: in some parts of North America, "panther" refers to the cougar (''Puma concolor''), while in South America it is used to mean the jaguar (''Panthera onca''), and elsewhere it is used to mean the leopard (''Panthera pardus'').

Depictions of a specific "panther" in media such as ''NetHack'' usually correspond to the [[Wikipedia:Black panther|black panther]], a melanistic colour variant of the leopard and jaguar. Black panthers of both species have excess black pigments, and have been documented mostly in tropical forests—black leopards are found in Africa and Asia, and black jaguars are seen in South America.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], panthers can generate in [[real zoo]]s.{{refsrc|mkroom.c|803|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} [[Werepanther]]s summoning help have a {{frac|5}} chance of generating a hostile panther on each applicable square{{refsrc|were.c|139|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} - a hero that gets lycanthropy from a werepanther can summon panthers as pets with the same probability by using the [[Monster (command)|#monster]] [[extended command]], which costs 10 [[power]].

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], panthers appear among the random {{white|f}} that are part of the second [[quest]] monster class for [[Cavepeople]] and make up {{frac|6|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Caveman quest]].

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], in addition to SLASH'EM details, [[Gladiator]]s can obtain gold by killing panthers.

Panthers appear among the random {{white|f}} that are part of the first quest [[monster class]] for [[Zookeeper]]s and make up {{frac|24|175}} (14%) of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Zookeeper quest]].

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], in addition to SLASH'EM details, panthers can [[jump]] after their targets.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|<poem>
And lo! almost where the ascent began,
A panther light and swift exceedingly,
Which with a spotted skin was covered o'er!
 
And never moved she from before my face,
Nay, rather did impede so much my way,
That many times I to return had turned.
{{right-align|[ Dante's Inferno, as translated
                by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow ]}}
</poem>}}
